description: regarding free and open source astro photography tools for linux, Siril is probably the best tool around that is also available from fedora repositories by default. It's a shame no other processing tools are included in fedora repositories and require separate installation of dependencies and compilation from source code which is not the way to go for most users.
summary: powerful tool, except for some special cases where it might crash

description: Stacking with Siril vs MaximDL yielded indistinguishable images; however, MaximDL memory use is much better. Expect to have issues if you are working with 10 or more images of 15 megapixels with Siril.
summary: Nice app, but memory usage could be improved

description: Use this to color balance, stretch, and adjust background for astrophotography
J'ai installé Linux à cause de cette appli...(Greg34)
